comments: Oladipo (MIA) and Young (ATL) engage and disengage with one another off-ball.
Hunter (ATL) brings his right arm down and marginal contact occurs with Oladipo's (MIA) arms as Oladipo makes the pass.
Okongwu (ATL) releases his left forearm away from Adebayo's (MIA) back and marginal contact occurs as the rebound falls toward the lane.
Hunter (ATL) slides his pivot foot at the start of his dribble.
Strus (MIA) brings his left hand toward Hunter's (ATL) front and marginal contact occurs as Hunter crosses over.
Adebayo (MIA) grabs and pulls Okongwu's (ATL) left arm in the lane, affecting Okongwu's ability to help on the drive.
Huerter's (ATL) right hand is brought forward toward Oladipo's (MIA) path and marginal contact occurs with Oladipo's arm/front at the end of the drive.

Huerter's (ATL) right arm comes down slightly and marginal contact occurs with Oladipo's (MIA) head and shoulder as he leaves his feet to pass. Contact to an opponent's head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Okongwu (ATL) and Huerter (ATL) legally contest Adebayo's (MIA) dunk attempt.
Oladipo (MIA) hooks and holds Young's (ATL) right arm, affecting Young's FOM as he cuts off-ball.
Tucker (MIA) places his hands on Hunter (ATL) as he sets the screen and as he disengages, the two players make incidental foot to foot contact that causes him to fall to the floor.
Young (ATL) brings his right hand toward Strus' (MIA) path and marginal contact occurs with Strus' front prior to the start of his upward shooting motion.
Young (ATL) extends his left hand into Strus' (MIA) back and initiates contact that affects Strus' jump shot attempt.
Strus (MIA) engages and disengages with Wright (ATL) during the inbound.

call_type: Turnover: Lost Ball Out of Bounds
comments: Strus (MIA) touches the ball last before it goes out of bounds.
Adebayo (MIA) engages and disengages with Okongwu (ATL) as Okongwu moves along/inside the perimeter.
Adebayo (MIA) and Okongwu (ATL) engage and disengage with one another along the lane line.
Adebayo (MIA) and Okongwu (ATL) engage and disengage with one another as Okongwu moves to set the pick.
Okongwu (ATL) firms up over his right foot and is turning away from Vincent (MIA) before absorbing the contact during the pick, which occurs simultaneously to the defensive switch.
Tucker (MIA) is moving alongside Gallinari's (ATL) path and retreating away from Gallinari when marginal contact occurs during Gallinari's upward shooting motion.

Okongwu (ATL) has a rested hand on Tucker's (MIA) left shoulder and quickly releases away as they each elevate to pursue the rebound. They each then make clean contact with the ball prior to any incidental contact occurring.
Wright (ATL) and Oladipo (MIA) each make clean contact with the ball and dislodge it away from one another prior to incidental arm contact occurring.

Strus (MIA) maintains verticality and absorbs the contact as Gallinari (ATL) moves into him in the corner, some of which occurs to Gallinari's face. Contact to an opponent?s head/face can be deemed marginal when the result of a natural basketball move, provided the contact is not disproportionate or uncontrolled.
Okongwu (ATL) establishes himself in a screening position in Tucker's (MIA) path and absorbs the contact.
Gallinari (ATL) brings his left arm toward Strus' (MIA) side and marginal contact occurs as Gallinari moves around Strus toward the corner.

Replay review of the out of bounds call pursuant to a coach's challenge was deemed unsuccessful. Possession remains with Atlanta after the call on the floor stands. The game clock was re-set to 0:05.2.
Gallinari (ATL) switches his pivot foot in the corner.

Strus (MIA) and Tucker (MIA) each maintain legal guarding positions as they double Gallinari (ATL) in the corner. As Gallinari turns toward the baseline to pass thereafter, marginal body contact occurs.
Adebayo (MIA) cleanly intercepts the pass intended for Wright (ATL) prior to any incidental body contact occurring.
After communicating with the Replay Center, it was determined that the game clock expired prior to Wright (ATL) committing a take foul on Adebayo (MIA).
